list_definition.definition: (the science of) growing and looking after forests

list_ex_of_english: Moreover, ' forestry laws and policies are contested, circumvented, selectively applied, interpreted and reinterpreted in their making and application ' (p. 56).
From a handful of scientific consultants and then the heads of struggling forestry administrations, the scientific enterprise had by the late 1940s enlarged considerably.

The section on the imperial advocates of forestry is particularly interesting.
The book is divided into six parts, targeting the pests of pasture, field crops and vegetables, fruit, forestry, weeds and nuisance pests.

The complicated and intricate pattern of forestry management in this period can be explained by the overlapping uses to which the woodland was put.
